availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas D. Snyder Jr. (Campbell County Kentucky, clerk, notary public and soldier)

body.p: Campbell County Kentucky, clerk, commissioner of deeds, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas D. Snyder and Margaret Snyder. Student in Campbell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk in Campbell County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Ohio Militia Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private and quartermaster sergeant from September 4, 1861 to October 4, 1862. Clerk at S. A. Sargent's House in Newport in 1862. Commissioner of Deeds for Kentucky in Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1862. Clerk at S. A. Sargent's House in Newport, Kentucky, in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 42B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 583.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Ohio, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M552, Roll 0102.
Official Roster of the Soldiers of the State of Ohio in the War of the Rebellion, vol. 12, 1861-1866 (Norwalk, Ohio: The Laning Co.), 163.
Williams' Cincinnati Directory for 1862, (Cincinnati, Ohio: 1862), 302.
Williams' Cincinnati Directory June, 1863, (Cincinnati, Ohio: 1863), 320.
